name: Blog Writer & Editor with Google Sheets Memory (GPT-4)

user.name: Robert Breen
user.bio: Professional services consultant with over 10 years of experience solving complex business problems across industries. I specialize in n8n and process automation‚Äîdesigning custom workflows that integrate tools like Google Calendar, Airtable, GPT, and internal systems. Whether you need to automate scheduling, sync data, or streamline operations, I build solutions that save time and drive results.

description:
Chat to **write** or **reword** a blog post. The workflow stores each result in Google Sheets and uses a sub-workflow ‚ÄúGoogle tool‚Äù to **count rows per session** (your running context). If a session exceeds a row threshold, the flow can branch (e.g., stop or notify).

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è Setup Instructions

### 1Ô∏è‚É£ Set Up OpenAI Connection
1. Go to [OpenAI Platform](https://platform.openai.com/api-keys)  
2. Navigate to [OpenAI Billing](https://platform.openai.com/settings/organization/billing/overview)  
3. Add funds to your billing account  
4. Copy your API key into the **OpenAI credentials** in n8n

### 2Ô∏è‚É£ Prepare Your Google Sheet
#### Connect your Data in Google Sheets
- Use this format: **[Sample Sheet](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1NwnABaQIReMmG2sRGrC-lv-5kpmsKJkUlRm-KmvPsCE/edit?gid=0#gid=0)**
- Row 1 = **column names** (e.g., `session`, `Rows`, `output`)
- Data in rows **2‚Äì100** (or more if you prefer)
- In n8n, use **Google Sheets OAuth2** ‚Üí pick your **Spreadsheet** and **Worksheet**
- (Optional) You can adapt this to **Airtable**, **Notion**, or a **Database**

---

## üß† How It Works
- **Chat Trigger**: Provide a topic (write) or paste existing text (reword).  
- **Code Node (‚ÄúChoose to Write or Edit Blog‚Äù)**:  
  - Builds a `system_prompt` + `user_prompt`  
  - Instructs the agent to call the **Google tool** (sub-workflow) **with only the `sessionid`** to count existing rows.  
- **Tool Workflow (‚Äúgoogle‚Äù)**:  
  - Fetches rows from the sheet ‚Üí **filters by `session`** ‚Üí **summarizes row count**.  
- **Agent (‚ÄúBlog Writer & Editor‚Äù)**:  
  - Returns **structured JSON** (items/rows, session, blog body).  
- **Store (Google Sheets)**:  
  - Appends `{ session, Rows, output }` to the sheet.  
- **If Node**:  
  - Example rule: `Rows > 3` ‚Üí branch/limit/notify as needed.

---

## üí¨ Example Prompts
- ‚ÄúWrite a 600-word blog about **n8n agents** with 3 bullet takeaways. Session: `abc123`.‚Äù  
- ‚ÄúReword this post into a concise LinkedIn article. Session: `launchQ3`:\n<your text here>‚Äù  
- ‚ÄúDraft a blog intro and 5 SEO headlines on **marketing automation**. Session: `mkt-01`.‚Äù

---

## üì¨ Contact
Need help tailoring this to Airtable/Notion/DB, or adding auto-publishing?

- üìß **robert@ynteractive.com**  
- üîó **[Robert Breen](https://www.linkedin.com/in/robert-breen-29429625/)**  
- üåê **[ynteractive.com](https://ynteractive.com)**

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).

parameters.description: call this tool to count the number of rows for the session id. pass only the session id to the tool

# ‚úçÔ∏è AI Blog Writer & Editor with Google Sheets Memory (n8n + OpenAI)

Chat to **write** or **reword** a blog post. The workflow stores each result in Google Sheets and uses a sub-workflow ‚ÄúGoogle tool‚Äù to **count rows per session** (your running context). If a session exceeds a row threshold, the flow can branch (e.g., stop or notify).

## Google Sub-workflow-tool
 Count number of times the blog was written and edited  **Dont forget to update this google sheet as well**

2. Navigate to [OpenAI Billing](https://platform.openai.com/settings/organization/billing/overview)  
3. Add funds to your billing account  
4. Copy your API key into the **OpenAI credentials** in n8n
